summary:
• Bangladeshi students protest despite government's ban on demonstrations
• Authorities struggle to maintain order amidst ongoing student unrest
• Students demand improved education facilities and resources

• Wildfires in Canada could spread smoke plumes to the US.
• Two people have died from Listeria, with 10 others infected in Canada.
• The outbreak is linked to non-dairy food products.

• A Colombian man led a secret life as a drug lord while playing professional soccer.
• He used his fame to transport drugs across borders without suspicion.
• His dual identities were eventually exposed by authorities, leading to his capture.

• The 2024 Olympic Games will be held in Paris.
• The city is hosting the event to commemorate its past successes at the Olympics.
• The event aims to build on France's Olympic legacy.

• Taylor Swift's Europe tour takes an unexpected turn as she performs in Gelsenkirchen, a city known for its football stadium.
• This marks a departure from her usual concert venues in larger cities like Berlin or Hamburg.
• Despite being an unconventional choice, fans are excited to see their favorite artist take center stage in this lesser-known German city.

• High temperatures in the Persian Gulf reach over 140 degrees.
• Iran denies plotting against President Trump.
• Unspecified US report reveals Iranian threat to President Trump.

• An Israeli man was killed in a drone attack on Tel Aviv.
• The UN's highest court is set to rule on whether Israel has breached international law by occupying Palestinian territories.
• Despite a surge in civilian casualties, the Israeli government claims that its military campaign against Hamas is nearing an end.
• Right-wing Israeli politician visited the highly sensitive Temple Mount site, highlighting his growing political influence.
• A prominent Israeli official toured the contested holy site, underscoring his rising power within the government.

• A journalist has been ordered to pay damages for mocking Italian Prime Minister Mario Draghi's height.
• The order was made by an Italian court after the journalist published an article ridiculing Draghi's physical appearance.
• This ruling highlights concerns over freedom of speech in Italy, particularly when it comes to public figures.

• Hezbollah leader threatens new attacks
• Threats made amid rising tensions between Israel and Lebanon
• Tensions escalate over potential escalation in conflict

• A drug trafficker had ambitions to become a professional soccer player
• Investigators were closing in on him due to his criminal activities
• His pursuit of soccer fame was overshadowed by his involvement in drug trafficking

• A waterspout was spotted off the Philippines coast.
• This rare weather phenomenon occurs when air rises rapidly in a thunderstorm cloud.
• The exact location and potential impact of the waterspout are unknown at this time.

• A Serbian suspect is being held in connection with the murder of a Rolls-Royce designer.
• The designer was found dead at his home in London.
• Police have identified the suspect through forensic evidence.

• The newly elected government led by President Cyril Ramaphosa has taken office
• Parliament is expected to address pressing economic and social issues during its first sitting
• The transition marks a significant shift towards stability and cooperation after years of turmoil

• South Korea appoints N Korean defector as Vice Minister
• Defector will work to improve relations between North and South Korea
• Appointment seen as step towards reunification

• Devastating warfare in Sudan leads to desperate choices.
• The ongoing conflict forces civilians to make difficult decisions.
• Desperation grips the people of Sudan amidst the brutal war.

• Zelensky praises Trump's leadership skills.
• Zelensky seeks Prime Minister's support in lifting Ukraine's weapons restrictions.
• Zelensky emphasizes Ukraine's determination and hard work.

• A Dubai princess has taken to social media to announce her divorce from her husband on Instagram.
• This public declaration goes against traditional customs in the UAE where divorces are typically private affairs.
• The move may spark debate about the role of social media in modernizing societal norms in the country.

• The new UK Prime Minister aims to repair relationships with European nations after years of disagreements.
• This move is seen as an attempt to boost cooperation and stability in the region.
• By doing so, the PM hopes to strengthen ties and promote mutual understanding between the two sides.

• In his marathon speech, Trump recounted being shot and said "it can only be a bullet" that stopped him.
• Melania made a rare public appearance to watch her husband speak at the convention.
• A US police officer who made a joke about an Indian woman's death has been fired.

• The tense election in Venezuela has sparked concerns about potential mass migration to the United States.
• The election's outcome is uncertain, fueling fears of instability and further economic decline.
• If the situation worsens, thousands may flee to the US in search of safety and opportunity.

• Vietnam's leader, Nguyen Phu Trong, has stepped back due to health issues.
• His decision comes amid concerns over his health and ability to perform duties effectively.
• This move may impact governance and policy decisions in Vietnam.

• Yemen's Houthis claimed responsibility for a drone strike near a US Embassy branch in Tel Aviv.
• The attack was allegedly carried out by unmanned aerial vehicles (UAVs) belonging to Houthi forces.
• This incident raises concerns about regional security and stability.
